result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendrick C Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kendrick C Evans is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kendrick C Evans was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $721.00 payable to Precious T; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Pursuant to negotiations, Count 1 is dismissed, Count 2 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 3:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Kendrick C Evans in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kendrick C Evans in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to add Count 3- Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Kendrick C Evans in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner. Irene Parthum for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial. Court GRANTS defense motion to vacate Jury Trial date of 04/06/2015. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Speedy trial demand withdrawn.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kendrick C Evans not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Final pre-trial, however parties request more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND (due 05/14/2015).

Attorney Brian C. Hagner in court, defendant Kendrick C Evans not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIES the defense motion for bail reduction.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kendrick C Evans in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda for Attorney Brian Hagner.  Defendant Kendrick C Evans in custody.  Paul Hauer for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: PRECIOUS T.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kendrick C Evans in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  
Defendant Kendrick C Evans in custody.  
William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
